Job Title: Project Manager – Finance Back to Basics program
Ad Text:
Make a meaningful difference with us  

We’re looking for someone who wants to make the world a little better through small moments that leave big impacts. To build meaningful relationships and make a difference in the lives of others. 

As a Project Manager – Finance Back to Basics program, you will lead with an Agile methodology approach to focus on delivering incremental benefits rapidly across our Finance function and ensure that end to end processes are considered and improved.  

In this role you will lead a team that address key pain points right across the finance function by identifying and addressing root cause. This would include analysing process and data flow for our different Finance streams to identify opportunities to streamline processes and address root cause issues that cause extra work. You will both identify and resolve issues (where practical) and will work with the Finance data analytics team to develop BI dashboards for the Finance team. 

Please note, this is a maximum term contract until 30 June 2027, with the potential for extension. Flexibility is important to us, and we know it is to you, too - this role supports hybrid working by agreement.  

Your part in our UnitingCare team:  

Lead team using agile methodology to deliver rapid and sustainable improvements to the Finance function in terms of efficiency and effectiveness. 

Develop solid stakeholder relationships with Finance teams to better understand their challenges and how the work of Finance Back to Basics is best positioned to drive sustainable work practice improvement in (simpler, documented, addresses root cause / takes less time)  

Run effective daily stand-up meetings to provide clarity of team and individual focus as well as a forum to celebrate success, raise issues and need for problem solving as well as escalations. 

Prepare Finance teams in collaboration with Finance Leadership to be ready to commence and prioritise end to end improvement using an agile methodology 

Support the facilitation of workshops, including value stream mapping, opportunities and planning workshops and co-design with stakeholders how key information will be retained e.g. through central process mapping tools, work instruction, role design, business logic, BI reporting etc.  

Test and ensure information being generated is “fit-for-purpose” and will enable a sustainable, embedded outcome within the Finance function.

Regular communication with the Finance Senior Leadership (including CFO) to discuss progress plans and ensure understanding of the nature of issues being resolved. 


What makes a difference for us? 

Tertiary qualifications in Business or a related field, with demonstrated experience in leading a similar program driving a Finance or Corporate transformation through data driven process improvement.  

Proven success working in a fast-paced outcomes focused delivery environment with a demonstrated ability to lead an agile delivery method. 

Familiarity with Process Mapping Tools, BI reporting and a greenbelt in Lean Six Sigma will be highly regarded.  

Demonstrated stakeholder engagement skills with the ability to build and develop positive and effective working relationships

Excellent written and oral communication skills with the ability to successfully influence and negotiate with key stakeholders to deliver outcomes within tight timeframes.   

Strong customer-focused attitude, commitment to actively display organisational values, and contribute to team goals. 
 

What makes a difference for you? 

The opportunity to be part of the second-largest Queensland employer who has been leading by example as a proud not-for-profit, for more than 100 years.

Flexible work arrangements to support work-life balance

Access to salary packaging, meal and entertainment benefits - up to $15,900 per year tax free as well as up to $2,650 of your pre-tax income to pay for meal and entertainment benefits

A recognition and rewards platform, providing employee discounts at hundreds of retailers, including everyday expenses, holidays, health insurance, a wellbeing program and employee assistance program

A positive and inclusive team based on respect, shared standards, strong values and a commitment to serving others

Career development opportunities to challenge yourself, grow and make a meaningful difference 


Diversity & Inclusion 

Our approach is simple –everybody is welcome here.  At UnitingCare, diversity is at the core of our who we are, our mission and our values. We are committed to providing equal opportunities to all employees no matter their sex, race, culture, sexual orientation, disability or gender identity. Demonstrating our commitment to reconciliation and building long-term employment opportunities for First Nations peoples, UnitingCare strongly encourages Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants for this position.  

Safe workplace 

We work hard to make our services welcoming and safe for every person. We are united in keeping children, young people and the elderly safe from harm, within our services, workplaces and the communities we support. We are committed to speaking up loudly for their safety.

Child safe, Child friendly   

UnitingCare is committed to being a Child Safe, Child Friendly organisation and will provide welcoming, safe and nurturing services for children, implement measures to prevent child abuse and neglect within our services and appropriately and immediately address child abuse and neglect if it does occur.

We have an excellent contract for a Change Manager within a Data Program. You will also be pivotal in the Learning and Development uplift for this program, helping drive the team and bring the business users along on the change and learning experience.

This is an exciting and critical program within in a fast pace employer of choice - you will enjoy acting at the intersection of business, organisational change and stakeholder engagement.

To be successful in this role, you will have previous experience working as a Change Manger across large complex data programs. You will be working with the adoption of the data governance tools and frameworks and driving the uplift of this across the business community.

Key Responsibilities

1. Change Enablement & Adoption

· Develop and implement structured change management strategies that support the rollout of data governance frameworks, tools, and analytics capabilities.

· Conduct stakeholder analysis, readiness assessments, and design engagement strategies tailored to business needs.

· Create adoption roadmaps and success metrics to measure change outcomes.

· Partner with business leaders, data stewards, and data owners to champion data-driven behaviours.

· Identify and address barriers to change adoption through coaching, reinforcement, and targeted interventions.




2. Learning & Capability Development

· Design, develop, and deliver learning programs that build data literacy and governance capability across the organisation.

· Facilitate workshops and learning sessions on topics such as:

· Understanding data governance and stewardship.

· Using data platforms (e.g., Alation, analytics tools).

· Responsible data use and decision-making with data.

· Collaborate with Learning & Development to integrate data capability into enterprise learning frameworks (e-learning, in-person, virtual).

· Establish and grow a network of Data Stewards and Data Champions to promote ongoing data awareness.

· Measure training effectiveness and adapt programs to improve knowledge retention and application.




What you can bring to this role:

5+ years’ experience in organisational change management, ideally within data, analytics, or technology transformation programs.

Proven success designing and executing change strategies and communications for complex initiatives.

Demonstrated experience developing and delivering data literacy training and capability uplift programs across all organisational levels.

Strong understanding of data governance concepts (e.g., data quality, metadata, CDEs, data ownership, stewardship) and data literacy concepts.

Familiarity with data platforms and tools such as Alation, Collibra, Power BI, or other BI/governance tools.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to tailor messages for different audiences.

If this sounds like you then please apply now!

About Us

Hanwha Energy Australia, part of the global Hanwha Group, is a fast-growing player in Australia’s renewable energy market, spanning energy generation, storage, retail, and financing. We are driving the future of distributed energy through innovative products that connect customers, technology, and sustainability.

The Role

We’re seeking a Strategy & Planning Manager to support the strategic growth of our Nectr Energy Retail and Distributed Energy Finance businesses. This is a key role at the intersection of finance, energy, and technology, ideal for someone who combines analytical rigour with operational execution.

You’ll work closely with the Head of Corporate Planning and collaborate with our executive team and HQ in Korea to translate strategic initiatives into actionable business plans, monitor performance metrics, and ensure commercial alignment across multiple business units.

Key Responsibilities

Track and analyse Australia’s energy retail and distributed energy markets, policy changes, and competitor trends.

Support execution of strategic initiatives across retail and finance portfolios, ensuring timely delivery and stakeholder alignment.

Monitor product profitability, hedging performance, and risk exposure; identify key drivers of variation.

Coordinate with lenders, advisors, and internal teams on financing, compliance, and risk management activities.

Manage project-level costs, schedules, and milestones; report progress to executives and HQ.

Prepare regular and ad-hoc business reports, investor updates, and operational reviews.

Provide analytical support for business planning, forecasting, and performance tracking.

About You

7+ years’ experience in corporate planning, banking, or financial advisory, ideally within energy, fintech, or consumer finance.

Tertiary qualification in Business, Economics, or Finance MBA or equivalent

Excellent communication skills in English and Korean, with proven cross-border stakeholder management experience.

Strong financial modelling and analytical skills, including P&L, cash flow, and sensitivity analysis.

Familiarity with credit policy, collections, or securitisation frameworks.

Understanding of renewable energy products (solar, battery, tariffs, VPPs) or a strong willingness to learn.

Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint, and BI tools; detail-oriented and execution-focused.

Why Join Us

Work with a globally recognised energy innovator at the forefront of Australia’s renewable transition.

Exposure to high-growth projects spanning retail, distributed energy, and sustainable finance.

Collaborative culture with international exposure and diverse, high-performing teams.

Competitive remuneration and career development opportunities within a growing organisation.

Ready to power the next wave of Australia’s energy transition?
Apply now with your CV and a short cover letter outlining your relevant experience and motivation for joining Hanwha Energy Australia.

Job Title: Director Service Insights & Improvement - Shared Services
Ad Text:
Director Service Insights & Improvement - Shared Services

Unique opportunity to lead innovation in service delivery across NSW Government
Temporary opportunity for up to two years
Total remuneration package starts from $218,617
Hybrid working arrangements available - Ability to travel to Orange, Goulburn and Parramatta is required

Are you a visionary leader with a passion for data-driven service improvement? As Director, Service Insights & Improvements, you will drive strategic initiatives that enhance service delivery across NSW Government through actionable insights, performance analysis, and continuous improvement. This is a high-impact role that shapes how government services are experienced by customers and delivered by teams.

Government Shared Services (GSS) is the home of essential back-office services for around 80,000 employees across more than 100 NSW Government agencies. With harmonised business processes and a whole-of-government approach, GSS delivers reliable and efficient transactional services that support public sector performance.

The GSS Business Process Operations (BPO) branch delivers scalable and efficient transactional services. Focused on continuous improvement, automation, and service excellence, the GSS BPO drives optimal customer experience and operational performance across the shared services landscape, creating value and enabling NSW Government outcomes.

In this role, you will:

Lead a multidisciplinary team focused on customer insights, data analytics, and service improvement.
Develop and embed a customer insights function.
Integrate customer experience data with operational and business metrics to inform strategic planning.
Design and maintain internal reporting frameworks and dashboards to monitor service performance and sentiment.
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to support escalations and drive service innovation.
Champion a culture of customer-centricity and continuous improvement across Government Shared Services.

We are seeking a strategic thinker and collaborative leader with:

Familiarity with NSW Government operations and shared services environments
Extensive experience in strategic planning, performance monitoring, and business improvement within the public sector.
Proven success in delivering high-quality corporate services and managing large teams.
Strong stakeholder engagement and communication skills.
Expertise in customer experience strategy and insights generation.
Ability to integrate multiple data sources to inform service delivery.
Relevant tertiary qualifications in management or a related discipline.

Your application should include an up-to-date CV which clearly details your relevant skills and experience to this position. A cover Letter is not mandatory but preferrable.

Click Here to access the Role Description. For enquiries relating to recruitment please contact Andrew Vouthivong via andrew.vouthivong@customerservice.nsw.gov.au.

Visit the Capability Application Tool to prepare for the recruitment process by accessing practice application and interview questions based on the focus capabilities listed in the role description.

Closing Date: 3 November 2025 (9:59am)

Careers at Department of Customer Service
A career at the Department of Customer Service (DCS) gives you the opportunity to help improve government services and be part of reform that benefits people across NSW. We are focused on delivering excellent customer service, digital transformation, and regulatory reform. Come join us and influence the future of our great state.

Belong in our diverse and inclusive workplace

The strength of our workforce lies in its diversity and embracing difference, while the key to our success is leveraging the contributions of employees with different backgrounds and perspectives.

You can view our full diversity and inclusion statement here.

We want you to bring your best self to this application process. If you have any support or access needs that may require adjustments to allow you to fully participate in this selection process (including an alternate format of the application form) please contact andrew.vouthivong@customerservice.nsw.gov.au

For more information, please visit

Information on some of the different types of disabilities

Information on adjustments available for the recruitment process

Salary: Up to $140K Including Super + Bonus (12 Month FTC)
Ad Text:
Our client is a diversified multi-asset fund manager offering products and strategies across Global and Australian equities. They are seeking a Data Analyst to join the Business Operations team on a 12-month fixed term contract, gaining exposure to investment data, APIs and modern cloud practices.

Key deliverables in the role: 

Extract, transform, and load (ETL) datasets from multiple sources

Monitor and maintain datasets, ensuring quality and integrity through robust QA processes.

Streamline automated data pipelines, build Docker images and distribute to Virtual Machines.

Oversee system processes, troubleshoot issues, and resolve failures promptly.

Redesign and implement processes in line with evolving business needs.

Skills & Experience:

3-5 years' experience in a Data Engineering / Analyst role, with competency in SQL and data warehousing.

Strong programming background (Python and/or R).

Any exposure to Finance or Regulatory Reporting teams is highly regarded

If this sound like you, please apply through the link provided. Successful candidates will be shortlisted and contacted.

Job Title: Business Analyst - SAP S/4 HANA cloud projects
Ad Text:
One of our leading clients based in Macquarie Park is seeking a talented Business Analyst with strong SAP S/4 HANA cloud projects experience to join them on an initial 6 month contract.

This is a fantastic opportunity to strengthen your expertise while contributing to a significant transformation project.

Responsibilities:

Collaborate with cross functional teams to gather and document business requirements related to P2P processes.
Perform gap analysis between existing systems and future solution to identify areas of improvement and opportunities for automation.
Assist in testing and quality assurance activities to ensure solutions meet business requirements and standards.
Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure user acceptance testing and training materials are developed and delivered to end-users.
Provide ongoing support to end-users to ensure smooth transition to new systems and processes.
Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or related field.
Minimum 4+ years Business Analysis experience with strong focus on SAP S/4 HANA cloud projects (private / public / sovereign).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities.
Knowledge of SAP ERP system is an absolute must 
You will be working with a company known for a good culture, unrivalled flexibility, competitive salary/ day rate and have the opportunity to work within a great team.
  
If you have the experience required and think this would be a great opportunity, then apply now.

WHO WE ARE
We are a financial services company that specialises in fleet management, vehicle leasing and salary packaging, with a presence across Australia, the UK and NZ. A total portfolio under management of $2.5 Billion and over 1200 employees.

www.sgfleet.com
  
OUR CULTURE
When adding a new member to the SG Fleet Group family, we look for people who embody our values, allowing us to provide an unparalleled customer experience. You will have the opportunity to thrive in a positive and fun atmosphere where everyone is valued and recognised for their efforts, whilst being a part of an amazing team.
  
SOME OF OUR PERKS INCLUDE

Recharge and relax with up to four extra days of leave each year. We call them Wellness days
We offer industry-leading 20 weeks of paid parental leave
Save plenty with vehicle salary packaging
Monetary service milestone awards
Recruitment referral bonus
Discounted mobility products and services
Flexible work arrangements
Career progression opportunities 
Education support towards your growth, including an individual learning budget per year, free access to LinkedIn Learning and more
Two paid volunteer days each year to give back to causes that matter to you
Health and wellbeing support including a subsidy and an innovative Employee Assistance Program
AS A SENIOR BUSINESS ANALYST 
Your main focus is to understand the customer and business needs, analyse and document requirements and communicate these to the architects, developers and testers and work with them to build solutions that achieve SGF’s goals and deliver the best business outcomes.

The major responsibilities of this position include but are not limited to:

Lead engagement with Product Owners and business SMEs to understand and analyse customer needs and business drivers. Collaborate with Product Owners to prioritise and shape the product backlog using best practices for prioritisation.
Lead requirements elicitation with key stakeholders to ensure that business owners and project team members have a shared understanding of scope and actual needs. Lead the identification of project risks, issues, and dependencies.
Lead the breakdown of complex business problems into epics, features and user stories with meaningful acceptance criteria and other supporting artefacts. Coordinate with the project team to develop a feasible and viable solution design. This includes running sprint ceremonies (huddles, retro’s, backlog refinement, sprint planning) where applicable.
Identify, recommend, and implement improvements and efficiencies across key business systems by analysing the current state and determining the optimal future state.
Develop and update process maps for business processes being introduced and changed.
Mentor Business Analysts and champion best practice methods where applicable. Assist with interviewing, onboarding, and orientation of new Business Analysts’ where applicable. Share knowledge and contribute to the Business Analysis community of practice.
Lead discovery and inception workshops.
Essential

Extensive experience as a business analyst.
Experience in managing and negotiating with multiple levels of internal and external stakeholders.
Ability to operate in an ambiguous environment.
Experience with IT applications and software delivery projects.
Experience dealing with multiple systems integrations.
Experience with designing and implementing processes across multi-functional areas.
Advanced experience in managing external and internal stakeholders with the ability to engage, collaborate and influence.
Advanced documentation, planning and organising skills.
Knowledge and experience using industry recognised solution delivery methodologies including Agile and Waterfall.
Excellent analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving skills.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
WHAT'S NEXT
We'd love to hear from you if you're ready to take on your next challenge at a company that embodies diversity and belonging while also offering work-life balance and career development.

We are a proud equal opportunity employer, and welcome everyone to our team. Resumes may be sent and interviews may take place prior to closure date for applications. To give yourself the best chance of selection, please do not leave your application to the application 'close' date. As a pre-requisite to employment, the successful applicant will be required to complete a pre-employment screening.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander candidates are encouraged to apply.

$160,000 - $180,000 p.a. fixed-term contract (12 months) + Super

Critical Requirement: Deep experience in the Energy Utilities Industry and SAP IS-U is essential for this role.

This is a strategic, hands-on leadership role where you will be instrumental in the end-to-end implementation of a significant Reform Project. You will partner closely with senior business, executive, and regulatory stakeholders to unpack complex challenges, define clear problem statements, and align business needs with cutting-edge technology solutions.

If you have deep domain experience in the energy sector, proven BA team leadership, and expertise in securing executive buy-in for major initiatives, we want to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities

As the Lead BA, you will be the driving force behind high-quality analysis and successful project outcomes:

Team Leadership & Uplift: Lead, guide, and coach a small team of three Business Analysts, setting the standard for quality, consistency, and stakeholder engagement.

Strategic Problem Solving: Lead ideation and discovery sessions to define clear, actionable problem statements aligned with strategic reform objectives.

Business Case Ownership: Lead the creation of Idea Briefs and Business Cases to secure project funding and executive endorsement.

End-to-End Delivery: Act as the lead BA from discovery and requirements gathering through to implementation, transition planning, and benefits realisation.

Senior Stakeholder Influence: Build strong relationships and influence senior leadership and regulatory bodies to drive alignment and critical decision-making.

Quality & Governance: Champion BA best practices, including quality oversight, traceability matrices, and alignment with enterprise architecture standards.

Solution Definition: Guide the development of high-level requirements to support market scanning and technology evaluation, including systems like SAP IS-U.

What You'll Bring

We're looking for a highly strategic and experienced professional with:

7+ years as a Senior or Lead Business Analyst.

Mandatory: Proven experience in the Energy Utilities industry (gas, electricity, or related projects), ideally within regulatory reform or network transformation programs.

Mandatory: In-depth knowledge and experience with SAP IS-U is required.

Demonstrated ability to lead and mentor Business Analysts, significantly uplifting team capability and ensuring consistent, high-quality delivery.

Exceptional skills in workshop facilitation, communicating complex concepts to non-technical users, and executive-level reporting (PowerPoint, Dashboards, Roadmaps).

A strong track record of developing successful business cases and securing executive buy-in.

Familiarity with enterprise architecture, user journey mapping, and experience with collaboration tools (Jira, Confluence, MS Planner, etc.).

If you're a high-impact Lead BA ready to drive critical reform within a major energy utility, apply today!

Please contact Joseph Demetriou (joseph.demetriou(@)aurec.com) for a confidential discussion about the role.

Toyota Finance Australia (TFA) is the country’s largest automotive financier.  Our past gives us credibility and knowledge. But it’s what the future holds, and how we can make the world a better place, that excites us. It’s not just about technology but what it can do for people.
  
In Australia there are two separate businesses: Toyota Motor Corporation Australia (TMCA) and Toyota Finance Australia (TFA).  While we work closely together, TMCA focuses on vehicles and here at Toyota Finance Australia our priority is to provide finance, insurance and fleet management.
  
At TFA we’re committed to empowering our customers to get into their new car and onto the road. 
  
We’re also passionate about, and committed to, our people.  Our philosophy of Here To Move You represents our commitment to not only move our customers, but help our employees grow. 
  
Your success at TFA is important to us, and we pride ourselves on a work culture that supports and rewards people.
  
From partnering with you to support your career growth, to providing you with opportunities to learn, improve, feel engaged and appreciated, we celebrate our people and the difference they bring.
  
We strive to create a workplace that not only gives equal opportunities to people of all backgrounds and abilities but supports them to reach their full potential.
  
We’re working towards a future where we look out for each and our planet.  Where we enrich lives with the safest and most responsible ways of moving.  This is the kind of tomorrow we’re imagining here at TFA.
  
Join us and help drive the future.
  
What you'll contribute to

As a Reporting and Analytics Specialist, you will manage the delivery of dashboards, reports, and ad hoc analysis along with actionable insights and manage related projects within agreed timeframes and to acceptable quality, as well as leading a
team of Sales Analysts.

How you'll make an impact

You will provide the business with detailed data, analytical and project support, and you will develop strong stakeholder relationships with business owners to drive productivity improvements and enhancements to dashboards and reporting to meet ongoing business needs.

People leadership – leading a team of Sales Analysts
Data Analysis and Reporting

Manage the delivery and refresh of Reporting & Analytics Team Dashboards and Reporting; both Scheduled and Adhoc to agreed SLAs and timeframes.
Develop and execute Reporting & Analytics Strategy in EDMP- Enterprise Data Management Platform in Azure / Cloud environment
Attend and/or contribute to the Data Governance Committee, Leadership meetings
Evaluate existing; or create new, technical solution designs to meet the ever-changing business/functional requirements
Ensure documentation of BAU Processes and Identify continuous improvement opportunities, working with Sales Analysts to implement the necessary changes.
Review developed reports and provide analysis and insights on trends and issues, requiring management attention
Business & Stakeholder Support

Review existing BAU Reports and data sources to assist the business in the extraction of insights for the Leadership Team, Regional Sales Teams and External Dealer Network.
Manage BI working group monthly meeting and the Regional Sales Analyst monthly meeting
Deliver Dashboard Training where required for the regional teams and Head Office team members
Your attributes

Experience with data mining, analytics, spreadsheet modelling and forecast techniques to support and lead team discussions 
Advanced Microsoft office skills, in particular Excel and VBA
Advanced experience in SQL and Databricks
Advanced PowerBI skills
Experience in leading a team
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Life at Toyota & What we offer you

We pride ourselves on a work culture that supports and rewards people. From development programs to recognition programs, we make sure everyone at Toyota Finance Australia lives their best possible life. After all, our people are our greatest assets.

Toyota Australia is well-recognised for offering:

Flexible hours and workspaces
Career Development
26 weeks paid primary carers leave & 8 weeks paid parental leave for secondary carers
Wellness facilities & Employee Assistance Program (private coaching available to you and your family)
Paid volunteer days to support your community / Employee Community Grants Fund
Employee Car Benefit Scheme
Building a great place to work

You're welcome to find out more by visiting our careers page: https://tfacareers.com.au/

We are an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

We are happy to adjust the recruitment process for your accessibility requirements. Please contact us and let us know your preferred type of communication and we will be in touch as soon as possible to discuss your requirements.
  
Toyota is an endorsed employer for all women.  Please review the Work180 website for further information.

Come with us and help create the future.

ASBRI is exclusively presenting candidates to a Federal Government agency for an experienced Business Analyst for a recently vacated position. The agency is undertaking a significant cloud and cyber security uplift, and this role will play a key part in supporting that transformation.

Responsibilities:

Review and enhance existing analysis, mapping, and operating frameworks to identify opportunities for improved cyber security posture and operational efficiency.

Engage with domestic and international stakeholders to gather insights, document findings, and inform design decisions.

Define organisational structures, groups, and roles to enable automation and support efficient migration processes.

Collaborate with internal and external technical teams to develop and implement business requirements, support market approaches, and contribute to transition-to-service documentation.

Skills and Experience:

Proven ability to develop functional and non-functional requirements for large-scale ICT and cloud projects.

Experience designing operating models and contributing to market approach documentation in security-focused environments.

Solid understanding of cloud and on-premises integration, and experience supporting cyber security initiatives.

Minimum of 5 years’ experience as a Business Analyst, with strong analytical and documentation skills.

Excellent collaboration, interpersonal, and written communication skills.

Additional Comments:

Hybrid work, office location is in Canberra city

Remainder of existing contract until end of August 2026 + 2 x 12 months extension options

How to apply:

Click apply and send through your resume. Ensure your resume demonstrates the skills and experience listed above.

Company: Talent – Specialists in tech, transformation & beyond
Ad Text:
The Opportunity


Our client is a community focused Federal Government Agency, seeking a SAS Data Engineer to assist with updating data development documentation and hands-on development with their data platform.


This will be a 12-month initial contract with a further 12-month extension possible, offering open-market hourly rates. This is a hybrid role offering strong WFH options, with an office location in Richmond or Geelong.

Responsibilities will include:

Provide technical leadership to the project delivery team through design reviews, advising on implementation best practices, defining and refining release process and technical workshops.
Review and refine the data delivery framework to enhance integration of new sources, performance of existing data delivery and rapid development of new subject areas.
Own the technical implementation of new data from analysis to delivery (designing and delivering data dictionary, defining the release steps, defining best practices of data modelling and review steps).
Facilitate continuous improvement measures in delivery principles, coding standards, documentation and provide training sessions to team.
Provide knowledge transfer sessions and peer review on best practices on development, data modelling, release process etc.
Prioritise work items and add them to a work queue.
Understand, analyse and size user requirements.
Development and maintenance of SQL analytical and ETL code.
Development and maintenance of system documentation.
Collaboration with data consumers, database development, testers and IT support teams.


About you:

Australian Citizenship is mandatory to be eligible to work for this Federal Government Agency.
Demonstrated competency in developing, auditing and reviewing code in 3 out of the 5 Data Warehouses listed - MS SQL ,Teradata, Snowflake, Redshift, Databricks.
High level of competency in Programming, including knowledge of supplementary programming languages such as Python, SAS, R or Java, including building ETL pipelines musing these languages.
Strong expertise with SQL, including experience with reverse-engineering end user SQL code and using SQL ETL frameworks like DBT or SQLMesh.
Develop and Customise SAS Visual Investigator data models, workflows, entities and rules to support investigative case management.
Ability to understand DevOps process and can use DevOps tools in accordance with the process.
Ability to demonstrate knowledge of version controls and its appropriate uses.


Desirable criteria

Monitor and troubleshoot system health, logs and performance using SAS tools.
Exposure to AWS Cloud, AWS S3, AWS Glue or similar tools within the cloud environment.
Competency with required systems, software and programs, including SAS and Excel, and demonstrated experience data modelling using metadata/model driven frameworks.
Tertiary qualifications in mathematics, statistical, computer sciences discipline or more than three years relevant work experience.



APPLY
Submit your resume, or for further information please contact Liam.Lasslett@talentinternational.com for more information.

Senior Network Analytics Engineer    

About Us:

Jemena is an Australian energy company who own and operate more than $12.4 Billion worth of gas and electricity transportation assets across Australia supplying millions of households and businesses with these essential services every day.

We pride ourselves on our innovative approach, technical expertise, and dedication to safety, quality, and sustainability. Our Group’s over 3000 team members; consistently strive to make a difference in the communities we serve. 

About the role

Are you a skilled and motivated Senior Data Analytics Engineer with a passion for developing high-performance software applications and driving data-driven decision-making?

We are seeking a talented individual to join our dynamic team and play a pivotal role in harnessing the power of data to fuel our organisations growth.  

Develop software applications to support data-driven and efficient management of the Jemena Electricity Network, such as network modelling and visualisation.
Collaborate closely with Asset Management Engineers, Operational personnel, and IT staff responsible for real-time IT systems (SCADA, AMI, OMS, DMS), and platforms.
Play an integral role in enhancing data-driven decision-making and optimizing the operation of the Jemena Electricity Network. 

A little about you:

Ideally you will have the following:

Ideally an Electrical Engineering, Data Analytics or Computer Science degree with a sound understanding of electricity network distribution and advanced metering technologies.
Significant experience in writing and maintaining high performance, multicore applications in R and Python/PySpark.
Significant experience in developing advanced analytics applications such as real time analytics and machine learning.
Significant experience in leading software design, development and lifecycle management in a team environment.
Proficiency in Unix, HTML, SQL. Databricks, and AWS will be highly regarded along with working knowledge of various data analysis techniques and methodologies, such as time series analysis, forecasting, tree analysis, ML, vector & geospatial analysis.
Proficient in strategic thinking, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
Effective written and verbal communication skills, adept at presenting complex information concisely. 

Qualifications:

Degree in Engineering, Data Analytics, or Computing Science.
Post graduate qualification in Data Analytics desirable.

Why you should come and work for us 

Our people are our energy source and we offer meaningful benefits and rewards that work for you. We offer the opportunity for long term career growth as part of our talent development and succession planning process. 

We are committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workforce that reflects the communities we are part of. We welcome applications from people of all ages, backgrounds, abilities, and identities. At Jemena, you belong.

About Cbus

Created by workers, for workers, Cbus Super is one of Australia’s most successful Superannuation funds. For almost four decades we’ve proudly represented those who help shape Australia, hard-working individuals who deserve to make the most of their retirement, no matter the industry. As an award-winning fund we’ve been recognised for the benefits provided to our members and our innovative investment approach.  All while staying committed to our member first ethos as a proud Industry Fund.

About the role

Step into a pivotal role where your work directly strengthens how Cbus protects its members. You’ll shape how technology and data risks are understood and managed across the fund, working at the forefront of regulatory change and major risk uplift programs. This is a rare chance to join a newly formed function, influence how it evolves, and see the impact of your work across the organisation.

Work closely with stakeholders across Technology, Data & Analytics & Cyber to embed strong risk practices. You’ll guide teams through assessments and remediation, maintain risk registers, support audits, and play a key role in shaping how this growing function operates.
In this role, you will:

Maintain and evolve the Technology & Data risk register using GRC tool.
Support internal and external audits, preparing evidence and coordinating audit meetings.
Facilitate risk assessments and help business teams document and address risks.
Partner with stakeholders to ensure remediation plans are in place and on track.
Coordinate regulatory responses and assurance activities.
Contribute ideas and improvements for process uplifts as part of a function that’s still evolving.

About you

You’re a risk professional who thrives on structure, problem-solving, and collaboration. You may come from financial services, Big 4, or a broader risk background with strong technology or cyber exposure. What matters most is your risk mindset and your ability to guide others through risk processes with clarity and confidence.
You’ll bring:

Experience in technology or data risk, IT audit, or first/second line risk roles within financial services or consulting
Working knowledge of risk frameworks and regulations such as CPS 230/234, ISO 27001, or NIST
Excellent communication skills and the ability to engage with stakeholders at all levels
A proactive, curious approach with a desire to build and improve processes
If you’ve been looking for a Technology Risk Analyst, IT Audit, or Operational Risk role where you can influence and grow, we’d love to hear from you.

Belong at Cbus

We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. We believe that, with diversity of perspectives and experiences, you get better teams and outcomes. We’re looking for people of all genders, races, nationalities, orientations and of all abilities to join us.
  
We’re keen to hear from you

If you've read through the requirements of this role and you feel like you haven’t fully met the criteria, we would still encourage you to apply. We're aware of accessibility barriers when it comes to applying for a job and we want to help. If you require assistance with your application, please contact our Talent Acquisition Team via careers@cbussuper.com.au 

Like to know more about working with Cbus? Listen to some of our videos with members of the Cbus team on our website, cbussuper.com.au/careers
  
Applications Close: 31st October 2025 – Interviews may commence sooner
This is a full-time position based in Melbourne
  
Agencies, please note: All Cbus vacancies are managed by our internal Talent Acquisition Team.  Should external assistance be required we will reach out to our preferred agency partners, Thank you.

Job Title: IT Change Management and L&D Lead
Ad Text:
Milestone IT is working with a leading retail organisation seeking an experienced Change Management and Learning & Development Lead to support a key data transformation initiative within a leading enterprise environment. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone who thrives at the intersection of organisational change, capability uplift, and stakeholder engagement.

This role will drive the adoption of data governance tools, frameworks, and practices across the business while helping build a culture where data is understood, trusted, and used effectively.

About the Role

You’ll play a pivotal role in designing and delivering change strategies and learning programs that support data literacy, responsible data use, and new ways of working with data. By leading targeted training, communications, and stakeholder engagement activities, you will help embed lasting change and foster a data-driven mindset across the organisation.

   Key Responsibilities

Develop and implement change strategies to support data governance initiatives.

Conduct stakeholder analysis, readiness assessments, and engagement planning.

Design and deliver learning programs to build data capability across all levels.

Facilitate workshops on topics such as data stewardship, governance, and analytics tools.

Build awareness and adoption of data platforms (e.g., Alation, Power BI).

Develop engaging communication content such as newsletters, infographics, and campaign materials.

Establish a network of Data Stewards and Champions to promote peer learning and ongoing engagement.

Partner closely with internal teams to embed governance into business culture and practices.

  What You Bring

5+ years of experience in change management or L&D roles within transformation programs.

A track record of successfully delivering change and communication strategies.

Experience developing and delivering data literacy or technical training programs.

Strong understanding of data governance principles (data quality, stewardship, ownership).

Excellent facilitation and communication skills, with the ability to simplify complex content.

Familiarity with data and analytics tools such as Alation, Collibra, Power BI, Tableau, or similar.

  Bonus Skills & Qualifications

PROSCI or equivalent Change Management certification.

Qualifications in Education, Communications, Data Management, or related fields.

Experience working in large-scale digital or cultural transformation programs.

Knowledge of enterprise learning platforms or data governance solutions.

  Ideal Candidate

Strategic yet hands-on, with strong delivery focus

Passionate about building a data-literate culture

Skilled in stakeholder management and cross-functional collaboration

Resilient and adaptable in a fast-paced, evolving environment

 

To apply online, please click on the appropriate link below. Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please contact Tina Miljkovic on (03) 9670 6682

About the role

At BOQ Group, we’re passionate about delivering better outcomes for our customers and communities. As a Senior Remediation Data Analyst, you’ll play a pivotal role in identifying, analysing, and resolving system and process issues that impact our remediation and risk events.

Working closely with a Remediation Manager and collaborating across teams, you’ll dive deep into system, process, people, and data challenges, especially those arising from breaches or incidents. Your expertise will help us understand the root causes, advise on business solutions, and ensure the right actions are taken to protect our customers.

You’ll be at the heart of our Group Customer Remediation team, partnering with Product Owners, Risk and Compliance, Digital and Analytics, and Core Systems teams. Externally, you’ll build strong relationships with key vendors and suppliers. Your work will span the end-to-end management of data and system activities, from data requests and financial analysis to developing tools, calculators, and control reporting.

You’ll also help design and deliver capability tools that support BOQ Group’s transformation projects, enhance data management, and drive automation and insight generation. Every day, you’ll champion our values - Spirited, Optimistic, Curious, Inclusive, Accountable, and Lionhearted - while ensuring we meet our compliance obligations and maintain the highest standards of integrity.

About you

You’re a data-driven problem solver with a passion for making a difference. With at least five years’ experience in analysing customer or financial data within financial services, you’re comfortable building and evaluating complex models to provide strategic insights. You bring a strong background in risk or regulatory projects and are adept at preparing presentations and papers for senior leaders.

Your technical toolkit includes proficiency with SAS, SQL, Python, R Studio, DAX, and Microsoft’s suite of tools, including Power Platforms and Dynamics. You understand data structures, big data, and portfolio data, and you’re skilled at ensuring data quality and effective data management. Your commercial acumen means you can develop governance tools to monitor performance and regulatory benchmarks.

Personally, you’re known for your analytical mindset, attention to detail, and advanced problem-solving skills. You thrive on collaboration, building strong relationships with stakeholders at all levels, and you communicate with clarity and confidence. Your time management skills are second to none, and you’re always ready to meet deadlines and achieve objectives. Most importantly, you’re committed to working inclusively and upholding the values that make BOQ Group a great place to work.

About Us

BOQ Group is a truly unique group of challenger brands with a purpose – to provide a genuine alternative to Australian financial services for customers and employees.

Our family of brands (Bank of Queensland (BOQ), ME Bank, Virgin Money Australia, BOQ Specialist), each come with their own defined customer audience and brand personality, but share one goal – to build social capital through banking. That’s creating trust with customers, exploring staff potential and believing that tiny gestures and big ideas can change the world for communities.

BOQ Group’s inclusive vision is to foster a workspace that values and leverages difference and creates new possibilities, a place where our people feel confident to bring their best selves to work every day. We embrace difference and believe that our workforce should reflect the customers and communities that we serve.

Since 2021, BOQ Group is recognised as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA).

In 2023, we successfully implemented an innovative Reconciliation Plan, driving positive change and promoting inclusivity across BOQ Group.

Our perks

At BOQ Group, we are passionate about creating an exceptional work environment that nurtures both your professional and personal growth.

Our comprehensive benefits package is designed to enhance your well-being, provide financial security, and foster a sense of community and inclusion. Here are just some of the fantastic perks you can enjoy as part of our team:

Flexible working arrangement - Balance your work and personal life with ease.

Discounted financial products - Enjoy exclusive rates on our financial services across the Group.

Salary sacrificing options - Maximise your take-home pay with our salary packaging options.

Paid parental leave with no minimum requirements - Spend quality time with your new family member without any worries.

Purchase additional annual leave - Need more time off? You can buy extra leave days.

Discounted private health insurance plan - Take care of your health with our special rates.

Employee Assistance Program (EAP) - Access confidential support for personal and professional challenges for you and your family

Access to employee network groups - Connect with peers through our First Nations Reconciliation, LGBTQIA+, Multicultural, Gender, Early Careers, and accessibility groups.

Pride in Diversity membership: We are proud members of Pride in Diversity and actively participate in the Australian Workplace Equality Index.

We are committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels valued and supported. Join us and be part of a company that truly cares about its people and community!

How to apply

To apply for this role, follow the links.

BOQ Group is committed to diversity and an inclusive workforce. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People are encouraged to apply.

We celebrate, value and include people of all backgrounds, gender and expressions, sexualities, cultures, bodies and abilities. When you apply, you are welcome to tell us the pronouns you use and please let us know any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

If you are successful for a role with BOQ Group, it is a condition of employment that background screening is completed to ensure that the Bank complies with its obligations under the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter Terrorism Financing Act. These checks may include, but are not limited to identity, verification, reference checks, criminal background checks, immigration checks, verification of academic qualifications, bankruptcy checks.

Please no agency applications.

About Us 

Future Secure AI (FSAI) is a leading enterprise AI company that was created in deep partnership with one of the world's largest financial institutions.

Operating as an enterprise company with deep relationships at C-suite with large global enterprises, FSAI believes humans and AI Workers will collaborate seamlessly to raise organisational performance. FSAI has dozens of partnerships with leading companies in most industries and regions globally.

FSAI has a strategic focus on expanding globally as we continue our extraordinary journey to transform the world with the most cutting-edge artificial intelligence.

The Opportunity

The Senior Data Scientist will play a crucial part in our state-of-the-art advanced analytics practices. You will join a team that fosters a strong culture of excellence and learning.

In this role, you will apply statistical modelling, machine learning, and analysis to build LLMs that solve real-world problems. You will unlock an array of different applications of AI and bring about positive change that could define society.

Not only do you have an impressive technical background, importantly, you shine for your soft skills which is shown through your clever ability to collaborate with teams and drive valuable insights.

You are highly conscientious, and you have the grit to find solutions and work through complex challenges.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop and deploy machine learning models that will have a profound impact on our product(s) and end users

Analyze large datasets to identify trends and patterns

Work across a range of use cases to improve the quality of LLM output chains

Plan and implement MLOps including benchmark monitoring for quality assurance and compliance

Provide strategic input for long-term data initiatives, including data governance and ethical AI practices

Work closely with engineers and stakeholders to implement innovative solutions

Mentor junior data scientists

About You

Ideally you are a Senior Data Scientist with 4+ years industry experience. You will be most valued for your strong communication skills, including active listening, consulting clients, and the ability to clearly explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. You’ll also be expected to collaborate seamlessly within a dynamic, cross-functional team.

You must also have impressive experience managing structured and unstructured data, applying statistical techniques and reporting results. You tackle challenges with a pragmatic mindset and a drive for impact, turning ideas into measurable results that make a difference.

To be successful you must demonstrate the following: 

Relevant tertiary qualification Doctorate or Master’s in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science OR related field AND 4-12 years commercial work experience.

Strong demonstrated history of data science experience and can concisely share examples of successful past projects

Ideally, you bring commercial experience with NLP techniques (supervised NLP learning with LSTM/CNN/Transformers and/or topic modelling), and;

Commercial experience with GPT (langchain, llamaindex, RAG, multi-agent framework). 

Advanced SQL and 2+ years’ programming experience in Python and Natural Language Processing

Excellent communicator with stakeholders at all levels

Empathetic, collaborative, open to feedback

Able to read and keep abreast LLM related research

Able to thrive in an agile environment

A Masters/Doctorate in a relevant discipline is a plus

If you're passionate about working with state-of-the-art technology, alongside experienced world-class leadership, and joining truly some of the best talent in the industry, we'd love to hear from you! 

For a quicker response, we encourage you to apply directly through our website at https://www.futuresecure.ai/. There, you can watch a video about AI workers and explore the career opportunities we have available.

We are seeking a Senior Manager to join our Intelligent Automation team and work with our clients to deliver high-quality automation. As a Senior Manager, you will be responsible for leading client engagements and managing a team of consultants to deliver high-quality services. You will work closely with senior leaders in the automation division to develop and implement strategies to drive growth and profitability.

Responsibilities & tasks for this role

Lead, manage, and train a team of developers to deliver intelligent automation solutions.

Be hands-on in analyzing, designing, developing, testing, and deploying automation solutions.

Oversee end-to-end project delivery, ensuring quality, timeliness, and client satisfaction.

Act as the primary point of contact for clients, building strong, trust-based relationships.

Identify business development opportunities and support proposal and pre-sales efforts.

Drive continuous improvement in delivery processes, methodologies, and team capabilities.

Stay current with emerging technologies (e.g., agentic AI, etc.) and translate them into client value.

Collaborate with internal leadership to shape strategic direction and service offerings.

Must-have qualifications & competencies

Minimum of 5 years of experience in automation

Proven track record of managing client engagements and developing strong client relationships

Knowledgeable in at least one area of consulting, such as strategy, operations, technology, or finance

Strong leadership and team management skills, with the ability to motivate and develop team members

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain strong client relationships

Bachelors degree in a relevant field, with an MBA or other advanced degree preferred

Able to attend our beautiful Sydney CBD office 1-2 days a week

If you're passionate about working with state-of-the-art technology, alongside experienced world-class leadership, and joining truly some of the best talent in the industry, we'd love to hear from you!

Analytics and Insights Manager - Loyalty and Partnerships




Harness huge datasets and work on projects to create innovative retail tools

Experiment with new ideas, taking a test and learn approach to your work

Sydney and Melbourne office locations considered with hybrid working




We strive to create better experiences together for a better tomorrow for our customers and team,  bringing the best of Woolworths Group and Quantium together to make data driven decisions. By partnering with Quantium, a world-class data science and advanced analytics business we’re excited about the future as we unlock the power of data to reimagine retail.




Through this partnership, the wiq team harnesses the best of Woolworths Group and Quantium data science and analytics talent to reimagine retail by solving the most complex problems using AI and analytics. As a team, we leverage Agile ways of working to help our team develop their skills while also making sure our team is focusing on solving the most complex problems for both our customers and team.




What you’ll do

As  Analytics and Insights Manager you  will be instrumental in shaping our Partnerships strategy by transforming complex data into clear, commercially-driven outcomes and will lead a team of Senior & Lead analysts within the Loyalty Partnerships Business Area. You will be accountable for the delivery of insights, analytics & data science solutions in this area. You will champion a data-driven culture. Acting  as a key advocate for the use of data and analytics in decision-making within the BU.







Take ownership and accountability for the delivery of data analytics, insights, data modelling, dashboarding & reporting for a distinct business unit stream within the Loyalty business unit.

Structure nebulous problem statements and develop hypotheses / issue trees to determine the solution(s).

Transforming data into actionable insights, creating compelling narratives and providing thought leadership to stakeholders, driving business value.

Triage, assess & prioritise incoming requests to the team in collaboration with key business stakeholders.

Provide line leadership for analysts within the business area, building & fostering a high performing analytics team.

Oversee data governance and output quality by establishing & maintaining output quality standards and governance processes for the team to ensure the accuracy and reliability of insights.

Foster cross-functional collaboration on data initiatives by actively seeking out opportunities to partner with other data and analytics teams across Woolworths Group to share best practices, leverage collective expertise, and work on joint initiatives.

 

What you’ll bring




Your exceptional  relationship building, provide thought leadership on ambiguous problems, and fosters a high-performing, data-driven team culture. Your provocative nature will see youidentifying opportunities for high-impact analytics projects that align with the strategic goals of the Loyalty business unit and creating  roadmaps for their execution.




Extensive experience working in analytics and insights, preferably in a loyalty program context and/or retail/FMCG industries.

Strong experience in leveraging advanced analytics to drive business value.

Ability to bring structure to nebulous problem statements and develop hypotheses / issue trees to drive insight in a structured way

Highly proficient in translating complex findings into a compelling narrative, driving business outcomes.

Demonstrated experience in stakeholder influencing & business partnering including the ability to seamlessly navigate diverse stakeholder environments.

Experience and knowledge of advanced analytical and statistical skills - A/B testing, regression, hypothesis testing.

Highly proficient in data query and manipulation (advanced level SQL).







What you’ll experience




Our Team Members are at the heart of everything we do and we’re always looking for ways to support your career journey and reward great work:




Team discounts across our range of Woolworths Group brands you know and love and a robust rewards program that celebrates and incentivises purpose-driven work.

A global business with endless career possibilities around every corner and across every discipline – with valuable exposure to a vast and exciting business network.

High impact role supporting our teams who enrich our communities. 

A range of programs to help you prioritise and manage your wellbeing, including 24/7 access to the Sonder app.







Endless possibilities with Woolworths Group




We’re a proud part of the Woolworths Group – 200,000+ bright minds, passionate hearts and unique perspectives working together connected by a shared Purpose – ‘to create better experiences together for a better tomorrow.’ 

Here you’ll be supported and empowered to explore new ideas, make brave commitments and innovate better ways to meet the food and everyday needs of more than 24 million customers every week. Backed by a culture of genuine care, a flexible approach to work and the support to grow your career and make a meaningful impact, the possibilities for what we can achieve together are endless.



Everyone belongs at Woolworths Group




Diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging are key to realising our purpose of better together for a better tomorrow. We recognise the value our team’s diversity brings to our business, customers, and communities and that teams with diverse experiences and backgrounds enrich our group and are better able to innovate and solve problems. As one of the largest employers in Australia and New Zealand, we aim to create a truly inclusive workplace where everyone feels that they belong, can be their best selves, and reach their full potential. We encourage all candidates to apply; please let us know in your application if we can support you with any adjustments in the hiring process.

Since 1977, King Living has pioneered quality Australian design, continually pushing the boundaries of what furniture can achieve.

Designed to adapt to our changing lives and last for generations, our furniture marries the power of innovation with traditional handcrafted methods.
King Living has expanded from a homegrown business into a global brand. A family owned and run Australian company headquartered from our Support Office in Sydney, our Showrooms and manufacturing centres span Australia, New Zealand, United Kingdom, Canada, Singapore, Malaysia, USA, China and Thailand.

At King Living, we are dedicated to creating simplicity and balance in both our living spaces and our work environment. We take pride in our past accomplishments and are thrilled by the possibilities of the future.

The Opportunity

We’re looking for an analytical and commercially minded Senior Manufacturing Business Analyst to join our Finance team.

Reporting to the Head of Financial Planning & Analysis, this role provides strategic financial insights and management reporting to support King Living’s manufacturing operations across China and Thailand. You’ll work closely with the CFO, Head of Manufacturing, and factory finance leaders to enhance financial performance, control costs, and support key business initiatives.
Regular travel to our manufacturing facilities in Shanghai and Pattaya will be required.

The Role
Develop, maintain, and analyse financial models to support strategic decision-making.
Deliver timely and accurate management reports across all manufacturing cost centres.
Partner with factory finance teams to ensure consistent financial performance and accountability.
Drive budgeting, forecasting, and five-year planning across global manufacturing operations.
Identify cost-saving opportunities and advise on corrective actions.
Collaborate on SAP S/4HANA implementation, supporting finance process mapping and data integrity.
Manage transfer pricing, customs duties, and international tariff analysis.
Support continuous improvement in reporting, planning, and analysis workflows.
About You
Degree qualified in Finance or Accounting, with experience in a manufacturing environment.
Strong analytical, modelling, and reporting skills using Excel and Power BI.
Experience with SAP, SAC, TM1, or equivalent FP&A systems.
Skilled in budgeting, forecasting, and variance analysis.
Strong commercial acumen with the ability to translate data into business insights.
Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills.
Highly organised, detail-oriented, and proactive with a “can-do” attitude.
Why You will Love Working with Us
Global Exposure: Partner with teams across Asia and Europe.
Convenience & Sustainability: benefit from complimentary onsite parking, including EV charging facilities at our Design and Support Centre.
Career Growth: Shape financial strategy within an expanding international business.
Innovation: Contribute to ERP and analytics system enhancements.
Collaborative Culture: Join a supportive, values-driven team that celebrates excellence and innovation.
Daily Perks: enjoy freshly brewed coffee from our onsite barista.
Generous Discounts: employee and family & friends discounts on our premium products.
Family First: paid parental leave to support you through all stages of life.
Our Values – More than Just Words Passion, Integrity, Collaboration and Innovation are the heartbeat of King Living. These values guide everything we do, from the products we design to the culture we foster. If you share our values, you will thrive here.
Our hiring decisions are not only based on your experience and skills, but also on your passion, attitude, and alignment with our core values.
King Living is an equal opportunity employer — all applicants will be considered regardless of your race, sexuality, religion, colour, gender identity, or parental status.

Macmahon is currently seeking a commercially astute Senior Commercial Analyst to join our team at Tropicana. This site-facing role plays a critical part in supporting operational leadership with strategic financial insight, cost optimisation, and commercial decision support.

About the Role

Support the Commercial Superintendent in compiling accurate monthly reports and review documentation.
Prepare monthly contract claims in line with compliance requirements and industry best practice.
Take ownership of Rise and Fall tracking, preparation, and application within monthly claims.
Lead the development and continuous improvement of end-of-month processes and ad-hoc reporting tools.
Assist in the review of all contract documentation to ensure accuracy prior to acceptance and execution.

About You

To be successful in this role, you will demonstrate:

A tertiary qualification in finance, commerce, or a related discipline
At least 3 years' experience in a commercial or finance role within the mining sector
Strong ability to interpret and apply contractual terms and conditions
Solid understanding of financial and accounting principles, with a focus on operational cost control and reporting

Employee Benefits

Paid parental leave benefits.
Continuous career development opportunities.
Dedicated support for lifestyle, financial, and mental health.
Access to exclusive employee discounts with Macmahon retail, vehicle, insurance, and banking partners.

Be More at Macmahon

Across Macmahon's team, you will find positive stories of people embracing opportunities to develop and grow their careers going on to celebrate impressive career milestones that contribute to our success. With over 9,000 highly skilled people in our team, we're proud of the values-based culture we have built over 60 years which is the driving force propelling our people to continually aspire to Be More.

About Macmahon

Macmahon is a leading Australian contract mining company with projects throughout Australia and Southeast Asia. Delivering a comprehensive range of surface and underground mining, civil design and construction, performance enhancement, and mine site maintenance and rehabilitation services to the resources sector.

Recruitment Process

Successful applicants must pass a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol screening, as well as criminal history and qualification checks. Proof of working rights in Australia (valid passport, birth certificate, citizenship certificate, or current visa grant notification) is also required.

Macmahon is an equal opportunity employer and strongly encourages suitably qualified women and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders to apply.

Macmahon Winning Values

United | Integrity | Courage | Pride

This is an exceptional opportunity to join a market leading global investment manager who is renowned for its strong working culture and is widely considered an employer of choice.  With emerging embracement and use of AI technologies, this newly created AI Risk & Governance position will play a key role in ensuring it is implemented and utilised ethically and effectively across the organisation.

The role will report to the Head of Risk and have an Enterprise remit whilst forming part of a global function and stakeholder group.  Leveraging your deep expertise in AI risk and governance you will collaborate with senior technology and business leaders to establish robust and scalable AI foundations whilst exercising sound judgement to make risk based decisions that balance business objectives with the protection of client and company data.

Key responsibilities will include:

Lead the design and implementation of robust AI governance frameworks, policies, and procedures that enable responsible innovation and regulatory compliance across the enterprise. Oversee day-to-day AI governance operations, ensuring adherence to company standards and proactively addressing compliance requirements and emerging risks.
Coordinate approval processes for new AI initiatives, conduct risk assessments, and implement mitigation strategies. Partner with Cyber Security, Data Management, Privacy, and other key stakeholders to monitor AI usage and ensure projects meet regulatory and ethical requirements.
Own and continuously enhance governance processes, including approval workflows and reporting mechanisms. Extend oversight beyond internal operations to include comprehensive monitoring of AI usage by third-party vendors, ensuring contractual compliance and alignment with ethical standards.
Build and maintain trusted relationships with internal business units and external suppliers, clearly communicating AI benefits and risks, and promoting a culture of responsible use across the organization.
Collaborate across a global organisation and engage with a diverse range of stakeholders, ensuring alignment of AI governance practices across geographies, business units, and functional domains.
Serve as a strategic thought partner on AI matters, mentoring emerging talent and contributing to cross-functional initiatives that strengthen risk culture and AI governance capabilities.
This pivotal role spans all aspects of AI—including risk management, architecture, infrastructure, enablement, model development, governance and validation, and third-party oversight—helping to drive responsible innovation and safeguard organizational interests.

Candidate Experience

Bachelor's degree in AI, Computer Science, Data Science, Risk Management or related field. Certified AI Governance Professional (AIGP) or equivalent certification strongly preferred.
Deep experience in AI, governance frameworks, policies and risk management with minimum 5-7 years in AI or related fields such as enterprise governance, risk management or data governance.
Strong understanding of AI technologies, appropriate guard rails, ethical guidelines and regulatory considerations
Exceptional organisational, communication and stakeholder engagement skills with the ability to build deep relationships, develop others, and achieve results through influencing, executive presentation and storytelling.
Exceptional ability to work quickly and independently with an outcome-oriented mindset, exacting attention to detail and sensitivity to deadlines.
For more information about this opportunity please contact Tim Carmichael at SMC Executive on 0409 154 322, otherwise to apply please click on the link below.

Are you an experienced Data Architect with a passion for solving complex business problems and designing cutting-edge data solutions? Do you thrive in hybrid working environments and enjoy contributing to strategic operations, such as responding to tenders, building proof of concepts, and participating in opportunity discovery meetings? If so, we want you to join us at Exposé!

At Exposé, we are one of Australia’s leading Data & Analytics consultancies, committed to delivering innovative, industry-changing solutions to some of Australia’s most complex business challenges. We're seeking hybrid consultants who are skilled in Data Engineering and Data Architecture to join our growing teams across Australia and play a key role in shaping our business operations and data solutions.

Why Exposé?

At Exposé, you’ll be part of a dynamic, collaborative team where culture comes first. We provide the opportunity to work on high-impact, challenging projects that not only solve business problems but also push the boundaries of data innovation. We offer a flexible hybrid working model, and we are committed to supporting both your professional and personal growth.

Even if you don’t meet all the requirements listed, if you’re passionate about data and eager to take on new challenges, we encourage you to apply.




What You’ll Be Doing:

Team & Delivery Coordination: You’ll lead the data team like a conductor, aligning priorities, coordinating backlogs, and ensuring timely delivery across data, AI and integration ecosystems.

Strategic Collaboration: Partner with key customer leaders (for example Managers and Architects to shape the strategic direction of the data team and champion the adoption of our new data ecosystem.

Solution Support: Provide hands-on support for engineers and analysts working with technologies such as Databricks, Snowflake, Fabric, Azure, AWS, etc.

Change Leadership: Drive change through technical excellence and influence across the data, AI and integration domains.

Stakeholder Engagement: Act as a bridge between business partners, architects, and business teams, ensuring that solutions align with broader business goals.

Requirements Translation: Convert complex business challenges into actionable priorities for the team, from ideation through to implementation.

What We’re Looking For:

Proven experience with cloud data, AI and integration platforms, including Power BI, Databricks, Azure (preferred, or AWS considered) and Snowflake.

Proven experience with modern data practice and regimes - including medallion, data mesh, and centralisation vs federation, and so on. 

Strong coordination skills to manage multiple priorities and tasks across an agile team.

In-depth knowledge of data integration patterns and architecture principles.

Ability to engage and collaborate with both technical and business stakeholders.

A change mindset, with a focus on uplifting platform maturity and enhancing team capability.




If you're passionate about data, driven to innovate, and eager to join an industry-leading consultancy, Exposé is the place for you. Apply now to embark on an exciting and rewarding career journey with us!

Note: Exposé does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies.

Are you committed to bringing your best to life every day?

At Acenda, we draw on over 135 years of heritage to empower a brighter future with security and confidence.
