As part of the global Nippon Life Group, we will enhance our capabilities and further strengthen our enduring commitment to putting customers at the heart of everything we do. And to support our partners to do the same.

We believe that when people have the support, clarity, and confidence they need, they can do their best work and build a future they’re proud of. We encourage our people to take life on – inside and outside of work – to grow and make a real impact for our customers, partners, and each other.

The role

Reporting into the Head of Data and Analytics, the Data Engineering Manager role is a 12-month fixed term contract opportunity.

As Data Engineering Manager, you will be responsible for leading the data engineering practice at Acenda, defining and implementing strategies at acquiring data and promoting the implementation and deployment of the Acenda Enterprise Data Warehouse.

As we continue our integration journey with Resolution Life Australia, bringing two enterprise data warehouses together, you will play a critical role in achieving that whilst providing strategic inputs to the Data Engineering & Information Architecture Leadership Team.

You will be responsible for overseeing engineering best practices, implementing a disciplined Data Engineering operating model, building, and maintaining a reliable data platform based on efficient ETL processes.

In addition, you will define and monitor data engineering metrics, analyse data, and lead partnership with other Data and Analytics team members to implement data assets (data lake, data vault, data marts) and process improvements initiatives.

In this role, you will also lead a team of dedicated and specialised Data Engineers. You will be responsible for providing mentorship and guidance to enable your team to be continuously developed and challenged meaningfully, as well as plan and prioritise the pipeline of work and any other strategic initiatives to be delivered.

About you

You are an experienced Data Engineering Manager with a minimum of 5+ years of experience in a similar capacity.

While you possess the required leadership capabilities and have experience in leading a team, you still play a hands-on role in your previous roles, enabling you to tackle and lead any technical troubleshoot or problem-solving and analysis work from the front.

You are well-versed in using Informatica as a data engineering platform and ideally have experience using Snowflake in an AWS environment.

Lastly, you possess the ability to build and maintain strong relationships with a diverse group of stakeholders across the business, enabling you to influence and contribute to meaningful decision making.

Your new opportunity
In this newly created role as the Director, Social Policy and Analytics Strategy, you will provide strategic leadership in the advancement of Queensland Treasury's social policy objectives. In this role, you will lead a team that brings a whole-of-government perspective to proactive policy analysis while influencing the social policy agenda across Queensland Government.

You will work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment to develop and deliver innovative initiatives and solutions addressing complex social challenges. As a highly strategic and driven individual, you will thrive in a position where you oversee a broad and impactful program of work and collaborate with diverse stakeholders across and beyond government to shape social policy outcomes that truly matter.

This role is available as a permanent or temporary contract up to 12 months, or a secondment from another government department, for the right candidate to join our team.

In this role, you will:
• Lead and coordinate a diverse program of social policy projects, collaborating with team members, stakeholders, and communities to deliver meaningful outcomes for Queenslanders.
• Deliver strategic, practical, and solutions-oriented advice on social policy frameworks and practices to a range of internal and external stakeholders.
• Exercise judgement, authority, and influence to effectively manage client requirements and team priorities.
• Provide effective leadership to a diverse and multidisciplinary team, fostering a collaborative and inclusive environment, encouraging open communication, and nurturing individual strengths to deliver complex projects
• Work closely with clients and senior executives, building trust and understanding to deliver solutions that meet their needs and create meaningful impact.
• Represent Treasury with integrity and clarity in challenging discussions and high-level forums, ensuring that social policy priorities are professionally communicated and delivered

What experience you will bring:
• Proven experience in program and project management or driving proactive policy agendas across teams.
• Expertise in preparing strategic, practical, and solutions-oriented advice.
• A passion and ability to be an agent of change and deliver meaningful outcomes.
• Highly effective communication skills with the ability to tailor your message to diverse audiences, both written and verbal.
• Strong interpersonal skills that enable the development of trusted working relationships, and foster collaboration and the sharing of knowledge. Whilst there are no mandatory qualifications needed for this role, relevant qualifications will be highly regarded.
